p: SARS coronavirus (SARS-CoV), a mutant of Coronaviridae, is pathogenic to hosts in the following two aspects: firstly, viral infections could directly damage the structure and functions of infected cells and trigger cell apoptosis; secondly, immune reactions and release of various cytokines induced by viral infections could not only eliminate infectious pathogens but also may deal severe damages on histiocytes due to excessive immune reactions.
